chart.title: Cancer death rate: crude versus age-standardized
chart.subtitle: The reported annual death rate from [cancer](#dod:cancer) per 100,000 people, based on the [underlying cause](#dod:underlying-cause-of-death) listed on death certificates. This is compared between [age-standardized](#dod:age_standardized) death rates and [crude death rates](#dod:crude-death-rate).

Age-standardized deaths from malignant n.descriptionShort: Reported deaths from malignant neoplasms in both sexes in those aged all ages per 100,000 people.
descriptionKey: The International Classification of Diseases (Version 10) codes that define malignant neoplasms are C00-C97.
Age-standardized deaths from malignant n.citationShort: WHO Mortality Database (2024) – with minor processing by Our World in Data
Age-standardized deaths from malignant n.citationLong: WHO Mortality Database (2024) – with minor processing by Our World in Data. “Age-standardized” [dataset]. WHO Mortality Database, “WHO Mortality Database” [original data].

Deaths from malignant neoplasms per 100,.descriptionShort: Reported deaths from malignant neoplasms per 100,000 people in, both sexes aged all ages.
descriptionKey: The International Classification of Diseases (Version 10) codes that define malignant neoplasms are C00-C97.
Deaths from malignant neoplasms per 100,.citationShort: WHO Mortality Database (2024) – with minor processing by Our World in Data
